cluster_classes.class_description: Animal groups that consume butterflies as a food source within the ecosystem, forming part of the food web around butterflies.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Butterflies also serve as a food source for birds, reptiles, and other insects...

members.entity_description: Vertebrate animals that use butterflies as a food source within the ecosystem.
Cold-blooded vertebrates that prey on butterflies as part of the food web.
Other insect species that consume butterflies as food within the ecosystem.

cluster_classes.class_description: General group of butterflies as organisms, including unspecified individuals, adult life stage butterflies, and female adult butterflies involved in reproduction and egg laying.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: All entities refer to butterflies as organisms, with some specifying adult or female reproductive roles within the same group.

members.entity_description: Butterflies are flying insects (order Lepidoptera) that undergo complete metamorphosis through egg, larva (caterpillar), pupa (chrysalis), and adult stages, with the adult stage being a winged, nectar-feeding pollinator.
Final life stage of butterflies as mature winged insects, capable of flight, feeding on nectar, reproduction, and often playing roles in pollination.
Adult female butterflies that lay eggs on specific host plants to begin the next generation.

cluster_classes.class_description: Entities directly involved in how adult butterflies feed, including their specialized mouthparts and the floral food source they consume.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Adult butterflies feed on nectar from flowers using their long, tubular mouthparts called proboscis.

members.entity_description: Sugary liquid produced by flowers that serves as food for adult butterflies.
Long, tubular mouthpart used by adult butterflies to feed on flower nectar.

cluster_classes.class_description: Animals that prey on or harm other life stages or organisms, such as those that attack caterpillars or butterfly eggs.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Animals that hunt or feed on caterpillars; animals that might eat or harm butterfly eggs.

members.entity_description: Animals that hunt or feed on caterpillars, driving their protective adaptations.
Animals that might eat or harm butterfly eggs, prompting eggs to be laid under leaves.

args.new_description: Animals and organism groups that prey on butterflies or their life stages (eggs, caterpillars, adults), forming the predator component of the butterfly food web.
args.justification: Both classes describe animals that prey on butterflies or their life stages, differing only by life stage focus, so they represent the same ecological predator concept and should be unified.

args.new_description: Animals and organism groups that prey on butterflies or their life stages (eggs, caterpillars, adults), forming the predator component of the butterfly food web.
args.justification: The merged predator class clearly belongs under a butterfly-focused ecological grouping that also unifies related interaction classes.

args.new_description: Butterflies as organisms (order Lepidoptera), including general, adult, and female adult butterflies involved in reproduction and egg laying.
args.justification: This class is the focal organism around which predators and feeding components are defined, so it should share the same butterfly ecology class group; type hint normalized to the organism concept.

args.new_description: Entities directly involved in how adult butterflies feed, including their specialized mouthparts and the floral food sources they consume.
args.justification: Nectar and proboscis are components of butterfly feeding interactions and should be grouped under the same butterfly ecology umbrella as butterflies and their predators.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes describe animals that prey on butterflies or their life stages, differing only by life stage focus, so they represent the same ecological predator concept and should be unified.

executed_decisions.new_description: Animals and organism groups that prey on butterflies or their life stages (eggs, caterpillars, adults), forming the predator component of the butterfly food web.
executed_decisions.justification: The merged predator class clearly belongs under a butterfly-focused ecological grouping that also unifies related interaction classes.

executed_decisions.new_description: Butterflies as organisms (order Lepidoptera), including general, adult, and female adult butterflies involved in reproduction and egg laying.
executed_decisions.justification: This class is the focal organism around which predators and feeding components are defined, so it should share the same butterfly ecology class group; type hint normalized to the organism concept.

executed_decisions.new_description: Entities directly involved in how adult butterflies feed, including their specialized mouthparts and the floral food sources they consume.
executed_decisions.justification: Nectar and proboscis are components of butterfly feeding interactions and should be grouped under the same butterfly ecology umbrella as butterflies and their predators.
